thread.title: Indictments handed down in Calhoun County murder
thread.title_full: Indictments handed down in Calhoun County murder - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Indictments handed down in Calhoun County murder
text:
PITTSBORO, Miss. (AP) - Two people have been indicted in the death of a man found on a Calhoun County road in July.
Frankie T. Jones of Pittsboro is charged with murder in the shooting death of 26-year-old Billy Covington on July 11.
WTVA TV reports ( http://bit.ly/1PIwYiK ) Covington's body was found on County Road 308.
Investigators say Covington died of a gunshot wound.
The grand jury also indicted Ashley Hobson on a charge of accessory to murder.
Jones is also facing charges of possession of a controlled substance and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
His bond has been set at $1.15 million.
Hobson's bond was set at $500,000.
Online jail records do not list an attorney for Jones or Hobson.
Information from: WTVA-TV, http://www.wtva.com
